item.title: Isabel add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Every habit he's ever had is still there in his body, lying dormant like flowers in the desert. Given the right conditions, all his old addictions would burst into full and luxuriant bloom." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Isabel add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "Miss Brooke had that kind of beauty which seems to be thrown into relief by poor dress." -- George Eliot

item.title: Isabel add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Happiness in intelligent people is the rarest thing I know." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Isabel add a quote by Max Ehrmann
item.description: "With all its sham, drudgery, and broken dreams, it is still a beautiful world. Be cheerful. Strive to be happy." -- Max Ehrmann

item.title: Isabel add a quote by Lois Lowry
item.description: "Memory is the happiness of being alone." -- Lois Lowry

item.title: Isabel add a quote by Ursula K. LeGuin
item.description: "The trouble is that we have a bad habit, encouraged by pendants and sophisticates, of considering happiness as something rather stupid. Only pain is intellectual, only evil interesting. This is the treason of the artist: a refusal to admit the banality of evil and the terrible boredom of pain." -- Ursula K. LeGuin

item.title: Isabel add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "Let us be grateful to the people who make us happy; they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom." -- Marcel Proust
